node.text:
Brand strategist @theannelihansson joins me on the heels of our most successful product launch “brand strategy fundamentals” as we discuss positioning.

This led into a conversation about Swedish auto company @volvocars and their sister brand @polestarcars. Watch the video for the rest of our discussion about branding, marketing and positioning.

If you want more information about the course, DM me the word “brand” to save a few bucks during the pre-launch.

#Entrepreneurial #newbusiness #homebasedbusiness #brand #businessquotes #mentorship #businesspassion #entrepreneursofinstagram #businessmen #mobilebusinesseducation #entrepreneurslife #entrepreneurmotivation #growyourbusiness #creativebusiness #businesscoaching #businessonline #womaninbusiness #successtip #businessstrategy #businesspartner #businesstip #businessideas #instagramforbusiness #smallbusinessmarketing #branding #marketing #positioning #businesstraining

node.text:
I had @manychat CEO Mike Yan (aka Kylo Ren) on talking about how you can use automation to increase engagement, build an email list and even integrate with SMS text messages.

Now til the end of August, you can sign up for a free 90 day trial. It’s fun, intuitive and powerful.

Resist the dark side of the force (dumb auto responders). Go to the light side and use smart automation that sounds and behaves just like you do.

DM the word “tour” if you want to sign up for the Futur Pro zoom tour Tuesday, Aug 17, 9am PDT.

#chatautomation #manychat #igtips #igautomation #socialmediamarketing #igtricks #igtipsandtricks

node.title: Big News! Chat automation is open to everyone

node.text:
@nidhitewarilcsw is a licensed social worker who helps others process trauma and anxiety. She’s my guest on this live stream.

We talk about imposter syndrome, critique strategies and the anxiety we feel before important events.

She’ll be speaking to the #futurpro community on weds at 8am PDT. If you are interested in joining us, dm me the word “Pro” to get more information.

#mentalhealthsupport #impostersyndrome #limitingbeliefs #limitingbelief #negativeselftalk #affirmationsoftheday

node.text:
In this video I talk about what it means to be in charge and taking care of people in your charge. This is the story of how @matthewencina quit @thefuturishere and why I’m happy for him.

node.text:
My friend Alex Preston was a freelance designer who lived with severe food allergies and medical conditions all his life.

He managed the best he could until he got so sick he was bed ridden in the hospital. What he does next is truly inspiring and a lesson for us all.

What obstacles have you had to overcome? What lesson did you learn?

Animated IG stories are right at your fingertips! #sponsored

Great IG stories will boost your engagement rate, drive sales and build brand awareness. But it's easy to get lost posting the same boring content. Which is why @impressoapp is so valuable. With the Impresso app, you can stand out on social media and create dynamic stories straight from your phone.

Over 200 professionally designed templates that are completely customizable, plus 5 new templates every week, means you'll never run out of options. Plus, the pre-loaded animations, graphics, and effects ensures you'll grab your audience's attention in the
best way.

Impresso has everything you need to create video content on your phone.

node.text:
Who can you trust? How to avoid fake gurus and what Mike Winnet calls “contrepreneurs”. They all follow a very specific formula to sell you a pipe dream—

You don’t need any special skill. You don’t need to posses any talent. Anybody can do it. It requires no money and little work and you can do it from anywhere by doing this one thing. Sigh.

Recently I was on the Millionaire Secrets podcast with @jefflernerofficial. We got into a fascinating and critical discussion as to why most creatives, designers (and entrepreneurs in general) will always struggle...
​​
​​...and never truly hit the big time. You can watch the full video on Jeff’s YouTube channel or on his podcast. Link in bio.

node.text:
The reason why we don’t share our story is because we aren’t very good at recognizing our own unique gifts and talents.

We let the fear of disappointing someone that holds great emotional power over us, prevent us from doing exactly what we need to do. I want to encourage you to step into the light and shine on. The world is waiting. Parts of this story was inspired by @matt_essam (who I’m happy to learn from).

node.text:
Some people have guts. And then there is @segurainc , the founder of type foundry T-26.

In design circles, his terms sheet is legendary for its bold, honest, direct and I don’t give AF approach.

If you work with him, you know what you’re signing up for. Respect.

Could you be this brave? Why? Why not?

node.text:
All my life, I’ve struggled with what to say. My jaw would clench up in anticipation of my turn to speak. My breathing became erratic and my mouth would get dry.

Later on, I learned that the best thing to do is not to say anything at all. Ask a question. Get the other person to keep talking. But don’t just ask any question, ask a beautiful question. Today’s guest post is by @nick.pkr . Follow him for more.

What’s your favorite go to question to get people to open up?

node.text:
Are your carousels being ignored, passed by and overlooked? It’s most likely because you lost the audience from the jump.

It doesn’t matter how good or valuable the content is if people don’t read it. Step 1, start with a title or headline that hooks people in. Use the second slide to rephrase the idea and grab the reader’s attention.

To learn more, read the carousel and follow today’s guest post author @itsjulekim. 

Step 2? Make sure “design” doesn’t get in the way of legibility. Clean layouts, bold typography, and legible typefaces are the key. More on that for another day.

#copywriting #copywritersofinstagram #marketingconsultant #marketingstrategist #marketingexpert #copywritingtips #marketingtip #marketingadvice #marketing #onlinemarketing #marketingtips #onlinemarketer #internetmarketingtips #onlinemarketingtips #onlinemarketingstrategies #onlinebusinessmarketing #onlinemarketingcoach #onlinemarketingstrategy #contentmarketing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'WRITE JUICY HEADLINES TO GRAB ATTENTION Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'Remember... "Nobody reads advertising. People read what interests them, and sometimes it's an ad." Howard Luck Gossage Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHY HEADLINES? It doesn't matter how beautiful or perfect your article or video is. They'll never see it if sevn they don't click. That's what the headline is for. Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says '1. MAKE A PROMISE State a specific benefit so the reader knows what's in it for them. "How to Create Content that Gets You Leads" Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says '2. ASK A QUESTION People are curious. They have to know the answers. "What Makes People Pull Out Their Wallets?" Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says '3. NUMBERS WIN Headlines with numbers or stats outperform all other types. "Boost Your Sales 457% with this One Tip" Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says '4. CHALLENGES Address a challenge or objection. "Create 50 Articles In 3 Months Even If You Hate Writing" Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says '5. HOW TO... Articles with "How To" are always solid choices. "How to Write Amazing Headlines that Sell" Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'TEST, TEST, TEST What does the reader like? Create 3-5 versions and use Coschedule Headline Analyzer or any A/B tester. Which wins? Jule Kim adviceactually.com ©2021'.

Photo shared by Chris Do—IG Business Marketing on September 15, 2021 tagging @itsjulekim. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Which headline tip did you like best? Hi, I'm Jule. Follow me for content and SEO advice. Jule Kim adviceactually.com Jule ©2021'.

node.text:
When the client pushes back on the bid, get creative. Negotiate performance based pricing. Get x% of every new customer. The client doesn’t pay anything unless the work you do gets results. You are incentivized to do really good work otherwise you don’t make any money.

It’s a win/win scenario.

A classic banger with @moismai . Go follow him.

node.text:
When you ask for feedback, it’s easy to react with emotion. Here’s how to process feedback in a healthier way that helps you to grow.

Guest post by @rightbrainedhuman. Follow her for more content like this.

Do you often get/give unsolicited advice from people? How does it make you feel?

node.text:
Time is money. But not the way you think. The labor theory of value argues “that the economic value of a good or service is determined by the total amount of "socially necessary labor" required to produce it.”

Except in many cases, especially when time is critical, people will pay more to have something done quicker. Express flights, overnight delivery, 1 hour turn around all carry rush fees.

Charging hourly goes against this basic economic concept. I charging hourly, value is placed on how long something takes versus how effective the solution is. Stop selling time. Sell results.

#pricingstrategy #pricingtips #pricingdesign #pricingcreativity #freelance #freelancetips #freelancelife #hourlypricing #pricinghelp #freelancerlife #freelancedesigner

node.text:
I’ve been looking at my highest performing posts to see if I can spot any patterns. A handful of posts have done remarkably well, especially this one from @thejamiebrindle where he talks about “Five ways to say No without losing the gig.”

As far as I can tell, this post did well because he was able to address a common, but powerful pain point that freelancers often struggle with—how to respond to clients who ask for too much. In doing so, people not only read, but saved and shared this post like crazy, and it turn became my highest performing post. It’s almost shocking that one post could get 6.1k new followers. One post!!

What have you learned from your best performing posts? Spot any patterns? What’s your best tip?

node.text:
Size matters. Length matters.

Don’t take my word for it. Today’s guest post is by the SEO queen @itsjulekim. Follow her for more useful tips on optimizing organic reach.

If you know what you’re doing, you can say a lot in 60 seconds or say little in an hour. The golden rule is be economical with your words. Don’t be overly verbose. Say it simply. Your audience and their shrinking attention spans will thank you for it.

node.text:
Pocket Full of Do would have never been written if it weren’t for a few factors.

After many years of producing content, fans and friends encouraged me to write a book. Which, by the way, is no easy undertaking.

To test the idea, I launched a Kickstarter campaign with a goal of raising $30k. I figured that if I couldn’t sell that many copies worth of books, it’s not worth writing. What surprised me was the amount of support that I received. We not only hit our fundraising goal but sold over $70k worth of books.

Five of our friends even backed it with $1k contributions. I think the quality of the book is good. But, I don’t think that’s why people backed us. It’s because when you give without expecting anything in return, it builds up good will.

People genuinely appreciate it. And when you ask for something eventually, they show up to support you. Thank you to everyone who shows up. Appreciate you.

Check link in bio to order a copy of my book.

Check out Greg’s Illustration for Designers course available now. Imagine being able to add the perfect, unique illustration to punch up your next project.

node.text:
Be my guest. No. Really.

If you want to submit a guest post for other content creators, pay attention to these tips from @thechristosnikas. Follow him for more.

There’s no guarantee that what you submit will be used or that you will attract followers, but your odds will increase if you pay attention to what audience the host attracts, their tone of voice and their design style. If you work within those guidelines and create something memorable and unique your chances increase.

Have you tried guest posting before? What has been your experience?
